attributes.action: David Cameron should be made to pay back £9.3 million he spent during Referendum
attributes.background: David Cameron should pay back £9.3 million he spent of tax payers money on pro-EU propaganda booklet during EU Referendum, money that could of helped out NHS

rejection.details: The leaflet was distributed by the UK Government. The cost of compensating tax payers as the petition suggests would be therefore borne by the taxpayer, so it is not clear how taxpayers could be reimbursed in this way.
